title: minerjones
author: minerjones
content: LOT 1: 2014 CryptoImperator 10,000 bits "1KckJacJ", PCGS MS65https://mempool.space/address/1KckJacJwjghjASsBr7eXzruVMxk2i5e1DSTARTING BID: 0.0100BTCLOT 2: 6x 2014 CryptoImperator 10,000 bits coins, PCGS graded**Coins have been redeemed and cleaned****Bids for this lot will work on the LIFO system as seen in previous auctions:1 @ xxBTC, 2 @ xxBTC, up to the maximum amount of coins for that lot**STARTING BID PER COIN: 0.0010BTCSTARTING BID PER LOT: SEE ABOVEMINIMUM BID INCREMENT PER LOT: 0.0001BTC**Please limit bids to ONLY 4 decimal places**END TIME: OCTOBER 7th, 2023, 14:00:00 PDT**Payment due within 24 hours of auction end!!**SNIPE: Any bid made in last 5 minutes PER LOT will extend the auction 5 minutes beyond the ending time PER LOT.If within those 5 extended minutes, a new bid is made, 5 minutes will be added to the auction from the time of that bid PER LOT.PAYMENT: bc1q0mj9njt50045qfuzewc4rut7su7cvg8nt89j3cSHIPPING: Based on location and preferenceOWNER: NOT DISCLOSED

comments.author: Kryptowerk
comments.body: Oh no, who redeemed these historical pieces. There were only 100 minted of these or am I mistaken?Also, first Bitcoin funded Crypto Imperator coins, correct?Lot 1: 0.01Lot 2, 3: 0.001 each

comments.author: minerjones
comments.body: Quote from: hoopstagaloop on October 02, 2023, 03:25:48 PMLot 1: 0.015BTCQuote from: Kryptowerk on October 02, 2023, 02:22:04 PMLot 2, 3: 0.001 eachCurrent high bidQuote from: Kryptowerk on October 02, 2023, 02:22:04 PMOh no, who redeemed these historical pieces. There were only 100 minted of these or am I mistaken?Also, first Bitcoin funded Crypto Imperator coins, correct?There were 500 made... 100 serialzed and then 350 non-serialized and 50 DIYAnd yes, this was their 2nd coin made after the 10,000 Doge coin in the same yearThe coins use the same back design and hologram

comments.author: Fattcatt
comments.body: Wow, I've been in here for years....didn't know that. CI's coin production #1 & #2...very interesting. Guess that I don't pay as much attention as I thought I did.   * What would we do without MJ???      He deserves a standing ovation, and many thanks for being this sites "Librarian" and the keeper of the Crypt(o) Secrets    THANK YOU MJ FOR ALL THAT YOU DO FOR US!!! WE APPRECIATE YOU

Agree with Fattcatt, MJ the all-knowing librarian. I got a 1-digit serial of these, happy to hear it's kinda a rare thing.Lot 1: 0.0151
